preamble.title: Nondisclosure Agreement
preamble.para: This Nondisclosure Agreement (Agreement) effective _________________, 2007 ( Effective Date), is by and between XXXXXX, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ( Disclosing Party), and _________________, a ____________________ (Receiving Party). Disclosing Party and Receiving Party may be referred to herein individually as a Party or collectively as theParties.

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to enter into discussions regarding certain business opportunities and such discussions may involve the exchange of data, financial information, trade secrets, or other information or intellectual property considered confidential or proprietary by Disclosing Party or its Affiliates (defined herein) which Disclosing Party desires to protect as confidential information (Potential Transaction); and
WHEREAS, Disclosing Party wishes to protect its respective proprietary and confidential information and trade secrets.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, terms and conditions set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

clause.para: Disclosing Party may disclose to Receiving Party non-public verbal, written, electronic or graphic data and information which the Disclosing Party considers proprietary and confidential, which may contain trade secrets, and which may include the information or data of an Affiliate of the Disclosing Party that is considered proprietary and confidential or may contain trade secrets ( Confidential Information). The Parties agree that all Confidential Information provided by or on behalf of Disclosing Party to Receiving Party, or to which Receiving Party is given access by or on behalf of Disclosing Party, whether in correspondence or other exchange of documents, during any interviews, discussions, meetings, and other interactions involving Disclosing Party, Receiving Party, their respective directors, officers, employees or agents, regardless of the form in which it is provided or exists, is considered by the Disclosing Party to be proprietary, confidential and to contain trade secrets and that such Confidential Information has economic value to the Disclosing Party. Accordingly, the Parties agree that all such Confidential Information shall be treated by the Receiving Party as confidential.

subclause2.para: The Receiving Party shall not disclose the Confidential Information to any other Person (except to the Receiving Party’s employees, including employees of its Affiliates, and advisors, counsel or contractors (collectively, the Receiving Party’s "Representatives") who have a need to know such Confidential Information in connection with the Authorized Purpose, and in accordance with this Agreement) without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; and

The Receiving Party shall safeguard the Confidential Information with the same degree of care to avoid unauthorized disclosure as it uses to protect its own confidential and proprietary information and trade secrets, but in no case less than a reasonable degree of care.

clause.para: The following information shall not constitute Confidential Information hereunder:

subclause2.para: Information that is or becomes available to the public through no breach of this Agreement;

Information that is received by the Receiving Party from a third party; provided that the source of such information was not known by the Receiving Party to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with, or other contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation of confidentiality to, the Disclosing Party with respect to such information;

Information that was already in the Receiving Party’s possession prior to its disclosure hereunder; provided that the source of such information was not known by the Receiving Party to be bound by a confidentiality agreement with, or other contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation of confidentiality to, the Disclosing Party with respect to such information;
Information that is independently developed by the Receiving Party without the use of any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party;

Information that is required by law or regulation to be disclosed, but only in accordance with
clause 5
; and

Information that is disclosed in response to a valid order of a court or other governmental body of the United States or any political subdivisions thereof, but only in accordance with
clause 5
.

clause.para: If the Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are requested or required (by oral questions, interrogatories, requests for information or documents in legal proceedings or by the Securities and Exchange Commission, subpoena, civil investigative demand or other similar process or pursuant to applicable laws or regulations) to disclose any of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information, the Receiving Party shall provide the Disclosing Party with prompt written notice of any such request or requirement so that the Disclosing Party may seek, at its sole expense, a protective order or other appropriate remedy and/or waive compliance with the provisions of this Agreement. If, in the absence of a protective order or other remedy or the receipt of a waiver by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are nonetheless legally compelled to make any such disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information to any Person, the Disclosing Party or its Representative may, without liability hereunder, disclose to such Person only that portion of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information that on the advice of its counsel is legally required to be disclosed, provided that the Receiving Party or its Representative making such disclosing will use its reasonable efforts to assist the Disclosing Party, at the Disclosing Party’s expense, in obtaining an appropriate protective order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information by such Person to whom disclosure is to be made.

Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party, including all copies thereof, shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party (or its applicable Affiliate). The Receiving Party shall either return or destroy all Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party received in tangible form (including any copies thereof), to the Disclosing Party within fifteen (15) business days following termination of this Agreement, unless the Disclosing Party requests, in writing, the return or destruction of the Confidential Information on an earlier date. The Receiving Party shall also, within five (5) business days following its receipt of a written request from the Disclosing Party, certify in writing that it has satisfied its obligations under
clause 3
of this Agreement with respect to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement to be effective as of the date first above written.
